item.title: 285 – Lot Recalls
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Lot Recalls His eldest daughter finds him in a dazed state, and the child, Moab, crying in the dirt, bloodied about the mouth, the old man bent at the waist, breathing heavily, staring at the ground glassy-eyed, a child’s toy … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Lot Recalls

His eldest daughter finds him
in a dazed state, and the child, Moab,
crying in the dirt, bloodied about the mouth,
the old man bent at the waist, breathing
heavily, staring at the ground glassy-eyed,
a child’s toy clenched in his withered hand,
a small carving cut from rock salt
sold by peddlers, pale and pink-grained,
a statue of some vague human form
shot through with afternoon sunlight, casting
a long ache of shadow across the threshold,
lurking at the cave-mouth, her father muttering
to himself, staring not at the shadow,
but farther afield, off across the plains,
towards the setting of the sun.

item.title: 284 – Jacob & the Son of Amittai
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Jacob & the Son of Amittai Broken in the bent of anger, the trickster diving deep to the ocean floor, or nearly, the liar hiding amongst the spotted flocks. Who knew the whale was a metaphor so deeply stirring? Who … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Jacob & the Son of Amittai

Broken in the bent of anger,
the trickster diving deep
to the ocean floor, or nearly,
the liar hiding amongst the spotted flocks.
Who knew the whale was a metaphor
so deeply stirring?
Who pegged the Angel
as not just than the Presence
but a brutal bitter man
who’d given up his only gift?
Each fished a hook out of his gut.
Each laid himself down to die
and, each, when resurrected, found
he had no path but the footsteps
he himself had made.

item.title: 283 – Sin
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Sin Simple hunger drew the Man to take and eat. Fallen from open mouths, rotting in the hand, so quickly returned to earth. Lament the fruit of your fathers! Take and eat and taste the bitter pips, piercing the throat’s … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Sin

Simple hunger
drew the Man
to take and eat.
Fallen from open mouths,
rotting in the hand,
so quickly returned to earth.
Lament the fruit of your fathers!

Take and eat and taste
the bitter pips, piercing
the throat’s soft flesh.
Words spoil on the tongue,
worms burrowing
out of the light, down
into the dark warmth
of the dirt.

item.title: 282 – Wrestling
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Wrestling After a long night doubt crept in. A new knowledge the Angel had never known. Great and awful wonder clouded the golden vision as dawn came on. The Angel shifted his grip to break the hip of the man, … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Wrestling

After a long night doubt crept in.
A new knowledge
the Angel had never known.
Great and awful wonder
clouded the golden vision
as dawn came on.
The Angel shifted his grip
to break the hip of the man,
Jacob, splayed sobbing in the dust,
turning great circles
in sudden agony and anger at the lack
of blessing. A blessing. A name.
He would not release the Holy Presence.
The Angel, staggered not by strength
but by will, gave up the name
Jacob had only ever desired:
his own.

item.title: 281 – Muybridge’s Horse
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Muybridge’s Horse Instant creation via cessation of a gallop learned over intimate millennia; knowing forever changed into floating. * Frozen, reanimated minutia our limits missed and now: the world come larger, more uncertain. If this is the form of horse, … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Muybridge’s Horse

Instant creation
via cessation
of a gallop learned
over intimate millennia;
knowing forever changed
into floating.

*

Frozen, reanimated
minutia our limits missed
and now: the world come
larger, more uncertain.
If this is the form of horse,
what more waits for us
between the frames?

item.title: 280 – fragment
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: fragment the sensation is one of short circuits of a door opening somewhere and the fear of someone coming in
item.content:encoded:
fragment

the sensation is one of short circuits
of a door opening somewhere
and the fear of someone coming in

item.title: 279 – soul (after Descartes)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: soul (after Descartes) marinade this meat we cleave to and from sloshes in. exquisite instinctual tang. a ghost holed up in the nethers neural nooks lost space between atoms. a fine powder. a kiss that lingers long after the press. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
soul (after Descartes)

marinade this meat
we cleave to and from
sloshes in. exquisite
instinctual tang. a ghost
holed up in the nethers
neural nooks lost space
between atoms. a fine powder.
a kiss that lingers long
after the press. eerie blue
burn of pilot light, lit
where heart meets
gut meets base of skull.
breath we take and give
and take and give and take
without thought, but
for moments it is kept
from us, held at length
and dangled.

item.title: 278 – Legion Speaks
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Legion Speaks I do not know his name or his whereabouts. I come from the tombs. I have come to know your dead. I have come to know the sky. I am not angry. I cannot sleep indoors. I cannot … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Legion Speaks

I do not know his name
or his whereabouts.
I come from the tombs.
I have come to know your dead.
I have come to know the sky.
I am not angry.
I cannot sleep indoors.
I cannot wear your robes.
I have no labor. No trade.
I cannot pay for your swine.
I am not angry.
My scars are my own.
Your women are of no concern to me.
I do not know your names.
I cannot speak your language.
I am not angry.
I am not angry

item.title: 277 – Legion Returns
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Legion Returns matted hair & wild eye. scars roped and tangled. graveyard shadows cast a pallor over wind-whipped skin. long-footed limp drags a turned aside line through the middle of town dividing cleaning the living & the dead. dogs walk … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Legion Returns

matted hair & wild eye.
scars roped and tangled.
graveyard shadows cast
a pallor over wind-whipped skin.
long-footed limp drags
a turned aside line
through the middle of town
dividing cleaning the living
& the dead. dogs walk nervous circle
on their chains. window panes
glare bright and hard at midday.
every door locked. for once,
everything is quiet. just wind
and the stillness inside
his empty head.

item.title: 276 – Knocking
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Knocking a paragon of vitality turns aside to cough I can’t help but see the end coming I swallow hard the moment passes as air through his fist clenched
item.content:encoded:
Knocking

a paragon
of vitality
turns aside
to cough
I can’t help
but see
the end
coming
I swallow
hard
the moment
passes
as air
through
his fist
clenched
